definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To bring (something) into contact with the air, so as to freshen or dry it.
examples: I'll hang these clothes on the rack to air them.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To let fresh air into (a room or a building), to ventilate .
examples: It's getting quite stuffy in this room: let's open the windows and air it.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To make public (an opinion , concern, issue, secret, differences, etc); to present to public view (and sometimes discussion).
examples: Residents used the public meeting to air their concerns about the poor state of the roads.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To broadcast (a television show etc.).
examples: The BBC decided not to air the controversial episode.
This game show first aired in the 1990s and is still going today.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , British , MLE , slang ) To ignore (a person).
examples: Why is this girl airing me?

main_definition: ( transitive ) To bring (something) into contact with the air, so as to freshen or dry it.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To let fresh air into (a room or a building), to ventilate .
( transitive ) To make public (an opinion , concern, issue, secret, differences, etc); to present to public view (and sometimes discussion).
( transitive ) To broadcast (a television show etc.).
( transitive , British , MLE , slang ) To ignore (a person).
